workflow.name: Generate YouTube scripts for shorts & long-form with Gemini AI and Tavily Research
workflow.description:
## **ü§ñ Automated YouTube Script Generator (Shorts & Long-Form)**

This workflow is a content multiplier. Provide a single video topic via a form, and it automatically researches, outlines, and writes two separate scripts: one for a **YouTube Shorts** and another for a **Long-form video**, saving both directly to Google Docs.

---

### **‚ú® Key Features**

- **Dual-Format Output:** Creates tailored scripts for both Shorts and long-form videos from one idea.
- **AI-Powered Writing:** Uses **Google Gemini** for all creative steps, from building a structured outline to writing the final scripts.
- **Up-to-Date Research:** Integrates **Tavily AI** to pull fresh, relevant information from the web.
- **Fully Automated:** An end-to-end process that takes a form submission and delivers final documents to your Google Drive with no manual steps.

---

### **‚öôÔ∏è How It Works**

After a topic is submitted, the workflow splits into two parallel branches:

1.  **The Shorts Branch:** This path is built for speed. It performs a quick web search and immediately uses an AI agent to write a short, punchy script.
2.  **The Long-Form Branch:** This path focuses on structure. It conducts a web search, uses an AI agent to first create a detailed outline, and then uses another AI agent to write a comprehensive script based on that outline.

---

### **üîë Prerequisites**

- An active n8n instance.
- A form to submit your video topic.
- API keys for **Tavily AI** and **Google Gemini**.
- Google Account credentials (OAuth2) configured in n8n for **Google Docs**.

---

### **üõ†Ô∏è Setup Guide**

1.  **On form submission Trigger:** Configure your form to accept a field for your video topic (e.g., a field named `topic`).
2.  **Tavily Nodes:** In both `Tavily` nodes, select or create your Tavily API credential and paste in your **API key**.
3.  **Google Gemini Chat Model:** In the nodes labeled `AI Agent` and `Create Outline`, select your Google AI credential linked to your Gemini **API key**.
4.  **Google Docs Nodes:** For all four Google Docs nodes (`Create Doc`, `Update Doc`, etc.), select your **Google OAuth2** credential.
5. **Activate the Workflow:** Once all credentials are in place, save and activate the workflow.

---

### **üöÄ How to Use**

1.  **Activate** the workflow.
2.  **Submit** your topic via the connected form.
3.  **Check** your Google Drive a few moments later for your the new script!

parameters.text:
=### CONTEXT
‚Ä¢ Video Title: {{ $('Tavily1').item.json.query }}
‚Ä¢ Style Reference (tone, pacing, formatting): 
{{ $json.style_ref }}

‚Ä¢ Outline with sub‚Äëpoints (exact order to follow):
{{ $('Create Outline').item.json.text }}

‚Ä¢ Requested Video Type: {{ $('On form submission').item.json['Choose video type'] }}

### TASK
Write a YouTube script **2‚ÄØ500‚ÄØ‚Äì‚ÄØ3‚ÄØ000 words** long that:

1. **Matches the requested video type automatically**
   ‚Ä¢ If `videoType`¬†=¬†‚Äúlisticle‚Äù ‚Üí produce a numbered list style (Tool‚ÄØ#1, Tool‚ÄØ#2 ‚Ä¶) with snappy transitions.  
   ‚Ä¢ If `videoType`¬†=¬†‚Äúexperimental‚Äù ‚Üí use a story‚Äëdriven, curiosity‚Äëbuilding narrative (e.g., ‚ÄúWe pitted four tools head‚Äëto‚Äëhead‚Äîhere‚Äôs what happened‚Ä¶‚Äù).  
   ‚Ä¢ If `videoType`¬†=¬†‚Äúhow‚Äëto‚Äù ‚Üí write step‚Äëby‚Äëstep instructions with clear sub‚Äësteps and demonstration cues (screen actions, clicks, etc.).

2. Intro (‚â§‚ÄØ30‚ÄØwords)
   ‚Ä¢ Capture attention immediately.
   ‚Ä¢ Do **NOT** mention any host or channel name‚Äîkeep it neutral.

3. **Body**
   ‚Ä¢ Follow the outline‚Äôs order exactly.
   ‚Ä¢ For each tool/section:
     ‚Äì Start with a heading in the form **‚ÄúTool¬†#X¬†‚Äì¬†<Name>‚Äù** (or ‚ÄúStep¬†#X‚Äù for how‚Äëto videos).  
     ‚Äì Expand into 2‚ÄØ‚Äì‚ÄØ3 short paragraphs (~150‚ÄØwords) covering key features **plus one practical real‚Äëworld example**.  
     ‚Äì End with a 1‚Äësentence segue that smoothly leads into the next tool/step (e.g., ‚ÄúSpeaking of collaboration‚Ä¶ let‚Äôs look at Notion¬†AI.‚Äù).

4. Outro / Recap
   ‚Ä¢ Summarize main takeaways in 3‚Äë4 sentences.
   ‚Ä¢ End with a neutral CTA: invite viewers to like, comment, and subscribe‚Äîno host or channel names.

‚ú≥Ô∏è  Language rule: Write at a 6th‚Äëto‚Äë8th‚Äëgrade reading level.  
‚Ä¢ Use short sentences (‚â§‚ÄØ18 words).  
‚Ä¢ Prefer simple, common words (say ‚Äúuse‚Äù instead of ‚Äúutilize‚Äù).  
‚Ä¢ No jargon unless you explain it in one plain‚ÄëEnglish sentence.  

### OUTPUT FORMAT
Plain text, one blank line between paragraphs, no JSON fences.

SCRIPT 1: Experimental type script

Intro:

Ever felt stuck on a task and wished someone could just guide you through it‚Äîstep by step/right on your screen?
Well, guess what? There is an AI tool which can do that. Hey google! Can you see my screen
Yes i can see your screen
Can you help separate the audio from this video
Yes i can help you with that, just right click on the file,.....
Wow, that was pretty cool, right?

In this video, I‚Äôll show you how to use this powerful tool step by step. Plus, I‚Äôll put it to the test with real tasks‚Äîlike working in Microsoft Excel, editing in Photoshop, or even help that I want with my PC.

So Stick around till the end, I‚Äôm A from my channel, and let‚Äôs get started!



Ever been stuck on a task and wished someone could just guide you through it step by step?
Well, that‚Äôs exactly what Google can do now.
It can see what‚Äôs on your screen and walk you through tasks in real time. And the best part? It‚Äôs completely free.
In this video, I‚Äôll show you the step-by-step process of using it and test it with real tasks like Microsoft Excel, Photoshop, and even setting up a new user on a PC.
Watch this video till the end to see what it really delivers.
So this is A from my channel and let‚Äôs get started.

Version 2:
Imagine learning complex software as easily as chatting with a mentor who knows exactly what you need. Sounds unreal? Well, it‚Äôs not‚Äîbecause that future is here.
Google has quietly launched an AI tool that‚Äôs changing the game. This isn‚Äôt just another chatbot or tutorial‚Äîit‚Äôs an adaptive, intelligent assistant that slashes your learning curve and skyrockets your productivity. And the best part? It‚Äôs completely free.
In this video, we‚Äôre diving deep into Google AI Studio to show you how it‚Äôs already making an impact. We‚Äôll walk you through how it works, what you can do with it, and how it can make learning faster and easier than ever.
Stay with me, because in the next 10 minutes, you‚Äôre about to discover a learning hack so powerful, you‚Äôll wonder how you ever lived without it.
So this is A from my channel and let‚Äôs get started.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
First, let‚Äôs go to Google AI studio,
Just click the link in the description
And it‚Äôll take you to this page
Click ‚Äòsign in to Google Studio‚Äô and sign in using your google account.
Now go to ‚Äústream real-time‚Äù

Here, you have three ways to interact with Google AI studio. You can talk to Google using your microphone, or show what you‚Äôre looking at through your webcam, or even share your screen so it can guide you step by step.
But before you start, remember that Google AI records your screen and microphone while you use it.  Google uses this data to train their AI model, so make sure you don‚Äôt have any confidential information on your screen.
I‚Äôm going to share my screen and see how it guides me.
You can click here and select the screen you want to share.
‚Äî--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
A: Hey Google, I need some help with Excel, and I just shared my screen.
Google: OK, I see. You need some help with Excel. Is there anything specific you need help with?
A: Yes! Can you see my screen right now?
Google: Yes, I can see your screen. I see a spreadsheet with sales data. What would you like to do?
A: I want to create a pivot table to analyze the sales performance of each country. Can you guide me through it step by step?
Google: Sure! First, please select all of the data in your spreadsheet, including the headers. Have you done that?
A: All right, I‚Äôve selected all the data. What should I do next?
Google: Great! Now that you‚Äôve selected all the data, click on the Insert tab at the top of the screen, and then select the Pivot Table option.
A: OK, done. What‚Äôs next?
Google: I see you‚Äôve opened the Create Pivot Table window. Now, select whether you want to insert the pivot table into a new sheet or an existing sheet, 
A: Let it be in new sheet

Google: Then click Create.
A: Yes, I did that.
Google: Now, since you want to analyze sales performance by country, in the Pivot Table Editor, under Rows, click Add and choose the Country field. Then, under Values, click Add and select the Sales field.
A: OK, done.
Google: Great! You have now created a pivot table to find the sales per country. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Wow, that was crazy! Google just watched our screen, understood what we needed and helped us solve the problem step by step.
Here‚Äôs a quick note: Each session lasts only 10 minutes and will automatically stop. If your problem isn‚Äôt solved, don‚Äôt worry, you can just start a new session and give a quick recap of what you‚Äôve done. Since Google doesn‚Äôt remember past chats, this helps it pick up where you left off and continue helping you.
Okay, Let‚Äôs start a new one.
Now, let's see how Google can assist with another tool. This time, I‚Äôll ask for help with Photoshop.
So let‚Äôs go back to Google Studio.
Click here to start the session.
I‚Äôm going to share my screen again.
Hey google, I need some help with Photoshop. Can you see my screen?
Google:  
A: I want to remove this person from this picture. Can you tell me how to do that step by step?
Google: Sure! To remove the person in the background, first, select the Object Selection Tool from the toolbar on the left side of the screen. It looks like an arrow pointing to a rectangle with a dotted outline. Do you see the tool?
A: Yes. I‚Äôve selected the ‚Äúobject selection tool‚Äù. Now what should I do next?
Google: Now, click on the person you want to remove.
A: OK.
Google: Once you click on the person, a selection of dotted lines will appear around them. Did that happen?
A: Yeah, I can see the dotted lines around the person.
Google: Now press the Delete key on your keyboard. Photoshop should automatically fill in the space with Content-Aware Fill.
A: Wow! The person is gone. That was super easy.
Google: You're welcome! Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Okay, let‚Äôs try something different. I‚Äôll ask Google to guide me through creating another user on this PC. 
Let me go back to Google Studio and share my screen.
A: Hey Google, I need to add a new user to my windows 10 PC. Can you help me with that?
Google: Yes! To add a new user on your Windows PC, first, open the Settings app. Click on the Start button at the bottom left of your screen, it‚Äôs the Windows logo,
then click the gear icon.
A: OK, done. next?
Google: Now, click on the Accounts icon. (It looks like two people.)
A: Got it. I‚Äôm in the Accounts section. What‚Äôs next?
Google: Now, on the left side of the screen, under Accounts, click on Family & Other Users.
A: OK.
Google: Now that you're on the Family & Other Users page, you should see a button that says Add someone else to this PC. Can you see that?
A: Yes, I see it.
Google: Great! Click on that button to continue creating a new user account.
Google: Now, it‚Äôs asking for a username and a password. Type in the username you‚Äôd like and a password, then click Next.
A: okay, Looks like the new user account has been created.
Google: Great! Is there anything else I can help you with?
A: Nope, that‚Äôs it. Thank you!
Alright, that was pretty cool! 
So, after using Google AI studio, I must say it‚Äôs super helpful in learning how to use a new software. It gives clear guidance and makes things easier. Of course it‚Äôs not flawless. Sometimes, it might provide incorrect steps, but if you notice an issue, just point it out, and it will correct itself. 
But overall, it does a great job walking you through each step.
So that‚Äôs it guys.
(This is how you can use Google AI to learn any new software.)
Hope you liked this video.
If you found this video helpful, do give it a thumbs up and subscribe to my channel.  
Thanks for watching
I‚Äôll see you in the next video
Take care 
Bye - Bye‚Ä¶

Google: Sure! First, please select all of the data in your spreadsheet, including the headers. Have you done that?
A: All right, I‚Äôve selected all the data. What should I do next?
Google: Great! Now that you‚Äôve selected all the data, click on the Insert tab at the top of the screen, and then select the Pivot Table option.
A: OK, done. What‚Äôs next?
Google: I see you‚Äôve opened the Create Pivot Table window. Now, select whether you want to insert the pivot table into a new sheet or an existing sheet, 
A: Let it be in new sheet

Google: Then click Create.
A: Yes, I did that.
Google: Now, since you want to analyze sales performance by country, in the Pivot Table Editor, under Rows, click Add and choose the Country field. Then, under Values, click Add and select the Sales field.
A: OK, done.
Google: Great! You have now created a pivot table to find the sales per country. Is there anything else I can help you with?
Wow, that was crazy! Google just watched our screen, understood what we needed and helped us solve the problem step by step.
Here‚Äôs a quick note: Each session lasts only 10 minutes and will automatically stop. If your problem isn‚Äôt solved, don‚Äôt worry, you can just start a new session and give a quick recap of what you‚Äôve done. Since Google doesn‚Äôt remember past chats, this helps it pick up where you left off and continue helping you.
Okay, Let‚Äôs start a new one.
Now, let's see how Google can assist with another tool. This time, I‚Äôll ask for help with Photoshop.
So let‚Äôs go back to Google Studio.
Click here to start the session.
I‚Äôm going to share my screen again.
Hey google, I need some help with Photoshop. Can you see my screen?
Google:  
A: I want to remove this person from this picture. Can you tell me how to do that step by step?
Google: Sure! To remove the person in the background, first, select the Object Selection Tool from the toolbar on the left side of the screen. It looks like an arrow pointing to a rectangle with a dotted outline. Do you see the tool?
A: Yes. I‚Äôve selected the ‚Äúobject selection tool‚Äù. Now what should I do next?
Google: Now, click on the person you want to remove.
A: OK.
Google: Once you click on the person, a selection of dotted lines will appear around them. Did that happen?
A: Yeah, I can see the dotted lines around the person.
Google: Now press the Delete key on your keyboard. Photoshop should automatically fill in the space with Content-Aware Fill.
A: Wow! The person is gone. That was super easy.
Google: You're welcome! Is there anything else I can assist you with today?
Okay, let‚Äôs try something different. I‚Äôll ask Google to guide me through creating another user on this PC. 
Let me go back to Google Studio and share my screen.
A: Hey Google, I need to add a new user to my windows 10 PC. Can you help me with that?
Google: Yes! To add a new user on your Windows PC, first, open the Settings app. Click on the Start button at the bottom left of your screen, it‚Äôs the Windows logo,
then click the gear icon.
A: OK, done. next?
Google: Now, click on the Accounts icon. (It looks like two people.)
A: Got it. I‚Äôm in the Accounts section. What‚Äôs next?
Google: Now, on the left side of the screen, under Accounts, click on Family & Other Users.
A: OK.
Google: Now that you're on the Family & Other Users page, you should see a button that says Add someone else to this PC. Can you see that?
A: Yes, I see it.
Google: Great! Click on that button to continue creating a new user account.
Google: Now, it‚Äôs asking for a username and a password. Type in the username you‚Äôd like and a password, then click Next.
A: okay, Looks like the new user account has been created.
Google: Great! Is there anything else I can help you with?
A: Nope, that‚Äôs it. Thank you!
Alright, that was pretty cool! 
So, after using Google AI studio, I must say it‚Äôs super helpful in learning how to use a new software. It gives clear guidance and makes things easier. Of course it‚Äôs not flawless. Sometimes, it might provide incorrect steps, but if you notice an issue, just point it out, and it will correct itself. 
But overall, it does a great job walking you through each step.

Outline:
To clone a web app
We‚Äôre going to do 4 parts
Part 1 - Generate the Web app structure.
Step 1: Create an account on Lovable
Step 2: Add a screenshot of the reference web app
Step 3: Get the prompt to create the app.
Demo of testing the app
Part 2: Make the App Work
Step 1: Connect the Web App to a Database
Sign up for Supabase using GitHub.
Create an organization in Supabase.
Start a new project in Supabase.
Link the project with Supabase.
Step 2: Get your OpenAI API Key.
Step 3: Add the API Key to the project.

Step 1: Generate a History Page 
Step 2: Generate an Authentication/Sign-up Page

Step 4: Edit any element in the web app.
Part 4: Publish your web app.

Intro:

What if I told you that you could clone any web app ‚Äî design, features, and all ‚Äî without writing a single line of code? Sounds wild, right? Well, watch this‚Ä¶

Yep, that just happened ‚Äî and it‚Äôs all thanks to a crazy-powerful AI tool I just found. 
In this video, I‚Äôm going to show you how to clone a fully functional web application in just minutes - the user login, database, custom design, and even publishing it online with a free domain ‚Äî all with zero coding!
I‚Äôll walk you through how to customize everything to make it your own and deploy it live with just one click.
So if you‚Äôve ever dreamed of launching your own app without the tech headache, you need to see this.
I‚Äôm A from my channel, and let‚Äôs get started!
To clone a web app
We‚Äôre going to do 4 parts
The first part is to ‚ÄúGenerate the structure of the Web App‚Äù
So in this part, we‚Äôll generate the complete structure of the web app, including its design and layout.
To do that
We‚Äôre going to do 3 steps
The first step is to ‚ÄúCreate an account on Lovable.‚Äù
This is the AI tool we‚Äôre going to use to generate a web app.
So to create an account,
Click the link in the description,
Now click ‚Äòsign up.‚Äô
And sign in with your Google account.
Okay, so now we‚Äôve successfully created our account on Lovable.
Once you‚Äôve created your account.
Let‚Äôs go to step 2, which is to ‚ÄúAdd a screenshot of the reference app.‚Äù
To clone any web app, you need to provide the AI tool with a reference image. This helps the AI analyze the design and layout, so it can create an accurate replica of the app.
First, you need to take a screenshot of the app you want to clone.
In this video, I‚Äôm going to clone 11 Labs, a popular text-to-speech AI tool.
So let‚Äôs go to Elevenlabs and take a screenshot of it.
If you‚Äôre using Windows, just press Windows + Print Screen. For Mac, you can press Command + Shift + 4
Once you‚Äôve taken the screenshot,
Go back to lovable
Click here and upload the screenshot.
Once you‚Äôre done,
Next we need to add the prompt to guide the AI to clone/generate the app for you.
So, let‚Äôs go to step 3, which is to ‚ÄúGet the prompt to create the app.‚Äù
To generate the app, we need to give clear instructions to  Lovable AI about what it should do. The more details we provide, the better the AI will understand and build the app exactly how we want it.
To make this easier, I‚Äôve created a ChatGPT prompt that will act as a chatbot and help us write the perfect description for our app. 
I‚Äôve given the prompt in the description,
Just copy the prompt
Then go to chatgpt and paste it here
And click send.
Now ChatGPT will act as an AI assistant and ask you a few simple questions about the app you‚Äôre cloning, like the type of app and its primary function.
Just answer them one by one.
First, it will ask the type of application that we‚Äôre cloning,
Since I‚Äôm creating a text-to-speech web application. I‚Äôll enter that.
Then, it will ask about the primary function of the app
I‚Äôm going to enter, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôll convert text to speech with different voice models.‚Äù
Next, ChatGPT will provide a list of the 10 best API providers and ask us to select one. This will vary depending on the type of app you‚Äôre trying to create. Since I‚Äôm cloning a text to speech tool, the AI cannot build the backend for the app. That‚Äôs why we need to select a text to speech API. 
If you want to use another API that is not on the list, you can mention it/them here.
I‚Äôm going to go with ‚Äòopen AI‚Äô, since it provides high-quality voice generation compared to the others.
Now based on your answers, ChatGPT will generate the detailed prompt to generate your webapp.
Once you‚Äôve got the prompt, we can generate the web app using Lovable
So to generate the web app, 
just copy the prompt, go back to Lovable AI, and paste it here.
Then, click here to start generating the web app.
As you can see, the tool has started writing the code for our app.
Once it's done, 
You can see our web application is ready, and it looks exactly like the screenshot we provided.
So now we‚Äôve successfully generated the structure of our app.
Next, let‚Äôs test the app and see if it works
Just enter a text into the input field and click Generate.
As you can see, The app is not working and has not generated the voice. 
Let‚Äôs ask Lovable AI why the app is not working and how to solve this. You can ask your question in a chat over here.
As you can see, it‚Äôs saying that API integration is not done. 
If you see here, it also suggests the solution.
To make the app work, we need to store the open AI API key securely in a database and integrate the open AI API Key. 
So, why do we need to do this? If we add the API key directly to our app, it will be visible to the public in the source code. This means anyone accessing the site could misuse it. So to keep the API key secure, we need to set up a backend server for our web app.
Next, let‚Äôs go to part 2 of this tutorial, which is to ‚ÄúCreate the backend for our app.‚Äù
A backend is essential to making any app fully functional. It handles storage, API integrations, and all the core functionalities. Without a backend, the app won‚Äôt work properly.
So, to create a backend for our app
First we need to ‚ÄúConnect our web app to Supabase.‚Äù
Supabase is a backend integration feature available in Lovable,
which lets us manage the database, user login, and file storage easily.
So, to connect it
Go to supabase and click ‚Äòconnect supabase‚Äô
(Again click ‚Äòconnect supabase‚Äô)
And sign in with your GitHub account
Now click ‚Äòauthorize supabase‚Äô
And it will ask you to create an organization.
This will be needed to connect supabase to your web app.
So let‚Äôs click ‚Äòcreate organization.‚Äô
Click ‚Äò‚Äôcreate‚Äù again.
Then click ‚Äòauthorize lovable‚Äô
Now we‚Äôve linked supabase to lovable.
To finish setting up the supabase connection,
We need to create a project in supabase.
This is where all your app‚Äôs data will be securely stored and managed.
To create it,
Go to ‚Äúconnect to a project‚Äù 
And click ‚ÄúCreate new project.‚Äù
Here, give a name for the project
Add a password 
and click ‚ÄòCreate a project.‚Äô
Now, we‚Äôve created the project 
Next, we need to connect the project/this to our app.
To connect it, go to supabase 
Click here and you‚Äôll see the project which you‚Äôve created.
click ‚Äòconnect‚Äô
And click ‚Äòconnect again.‚Äô
So now we‚Äôve successfully connected our web app to supabase.
Let‚Äôs ask Lovable for the next steps to make our app work. 
As you can see, it‚Äôs suggesting that we need the OpenAI API key to enable the app‚Äôs text-to-speech functionality.
But remember, these steps might be different depending on the type of app you‚Äôre creating.
Next, let‚Äôs see how to get the open ai api key
To get the api key 
Click here
It‚Äôll take you to open ai
Now click ‚Äòlogin‚Äô 
And sign in with your Google account.
Here, click ‚Äòcreate new secret key‚Äô
The,n enter a name and click create key 
And the api key will be created.
Once you‚Äôve got the API key
To add this key to your app,
Copy it, and go back to ‚Äúlovable.
Click ‚ÄòAdd API Key.‚Äô 
Paste the key into the input field and click ‚ÄòSubmit.‚Äô 
Once you‚Äôve added the api key, 
The tool will secure your/the API key in the database.
And it‚Äôs done. 
So now we‚Äôve successfully created the backend for our app and it‚Äôs ready to use.
Testing the app
Okay, let‚Äôs test our app and see how it works.
First, we‚Äôll enter the text in this field and click ‚Äògenerate‚Äô
The voice has been generated. Let‚Äôs play it
Well, that sounds great, actually! We can download the audio by clicking here.
We can also try out different voice models. Let‚Äôs select a new one and adjust the stability setting to make the voice sound more natural.
And click generate.
There it is; the audio has been generated with the selected voice.
Now that we‚Äôve tested our app, it‚Äôs working perfectly.
Next, let‚Äôs go to part 3 of this tutorial, which is to ‚ÄúCustomize your web app‚Äù
Now, if you see here, our app doesn‚Äôt have the option to store the generated audio files.
History page 
Next, let‚Äôs see how to create a history page on our app where all the generated audio files are displayed, like this. 
So to create the history page,
Let‚Äôs go to the chat 
I‚Äôm going to instruct lovable to create a history page where I can see all the generated audio and ask it to store them in supabase (bucket).
As you can see, the tool has started writing SQL commands to create a Storage Bucket for the Audio files.
Once it‚Äôs done
We‚Äôll get the ‚Äúapply changes‚Äù button here
Click on it 
As you can see, the history page has been added to our app.
To check if the history page works, let‚Äôs generate a new voice. 
Then, if we refresh this page and go to history
You can see that, we have the generated audio file.
Now that we‚Äôve successfully created a history page for our app.
Let‚Äôs confirm/test if the audio files are stored properly in the database.
To check that
Let‚Äôs go to supabase dashboard
Go here and click ‚Äòstorage‚Äô
Here, there will be a folder called Audio Files, where all the generated audio files will be displayed.
Okay
Right now, anyone can access and use our web app. But what if we want only registered users to access it?
Signup page
Next, let‚Äôs see how to create the authentication page for our app, which is basically a sign-in page for the users.
To create it
Like we did before, let‚Äôs instruct the tool to create the authentication page for our web.
Then click here
You can see that, the tool has started working on it, and it also created a table to store user data.
Once that‚Äôs done
Click ‚Äòapply changes‚Äô
And you can see that, the signup page has been added to our web app.
Let‚Äôs sign up 
First, go to the signup page
Enter the email and password
Then click ‚Äòsign up‚Äô
And that‚Äôs it we‚Äôve signed up.
Let‚Äôs check if our user details are stored on the database
To do that
Let‚Äôs click ‚Äòusers‚Äô
Here you can see that, the user details are stored here
So now, any registered user can log in to the app and access it securely.
Now, we have created the authentication page for our web app.
Alright!
Landing page
Next, let‚Äôs create a landing page for our web app.
This is the first page users will see when they visit your app, so it‚Äôs important to make it visually appealing.
So to create the landing page
Let‚Äôs instruct lovable to add a landing page with the features required and click here
Now you can see that, our landing page has been created.
If we click this button, 
It‚Äôll take us to the sign up page.
So now we‚Äôve successfully created the landing page for our web app.
Let‚Äôs say you want to change any element on your app
How will you do that?
Customize the app
Next, let‚Äôs see how you can customize the elements on your app.
To do that
Go to ‚Äòedit‚Äô here
Now click the element which you want to change 
I‚Äôm going to change this content

Now, let‚Äôs say you want to change the color of this button. Just click on it, and you‚Äôll get options to adjust the color and even the size.

Okay, once you‚Äôre done with the customization
Publish the app
Let‚Äôs go to the final part, which is to ‚Äúpublish your web app.‚Äù

=You are a research assistant and YouTube script researcher.

## INPUTS
‚Ä¢ Topic¬†/¬†Video¬†Title¬†¬†‚Üí¬†{{ $('Tavily1').item.json.query }}
‚Ä¢ Scraped source texts¬†¬†‚Üí¬†{{ JSON.stringify($node["Tavily1"].json.results) }}   ‚Üê n8n expression; leave unchanged.

## TASK
1. Read every source in **scraped source texts**.  
2. Extract the most relevant points that match the exact topic above‚Äîignore off‚Äëtopic info.  
3. Create a **detailed research summary** (‚âà‚ÄØ1000‚ÄØwords) in *plain English*.

## LANGUAGE & TONE
‚Ä¢ Aim for a 6th‚Äëto‚Äë8th‚Äëgrade reading level.  
‚Ä¢ Short sentences (‚â§‚ÄØ18‚ÄØwords).  
‚Ä¢ Prefer common words (‚Äúuse‚Äù‚ÄØ>‚ÄØ‚Äúutilize‚Äù).  
‚Ä¢ No jargon unless you explain it in one simple sentence.  
‚Ä¢ Do **not** mention any host or channel name.

## STRUCTURE
Return plain text with one blank line between sections:

**Intro (‚â§‚ÄØ30‚ÄØwords)** ‚Äì a catchy hook that frames why the viewer should care.

**Main Summary** ‚Äì depends on the topic type  
‚ó¶ **If the topic is a *listicle*** ‚Üí  
   ‚Äì Remove duplicate items across sources.  
   ‚Äì For each unique item, write:  
     ‚Ä¢ Item¬†#X¬†‚Äì¬†Name  (bold the name)  
       ‚Äì Key spec¬†/¬†feature¬†#1  
       ‚Äì Key spec¬†/¬†feature¬†#2  
       ‚Äì One real‚Äëworld benefit or use case (1‚ÄØsentence)  

‚ó¶ **If the topic is a *how‚Äëto* guide** ‚Üí  
   ‚Äì Compare all methods across sites, pick the best approach.  
   ‚Äì Present clear **Step¬†#1, Step¬†#2 ‚Ä¶** instructions, adding 1‚Äësentence tips where helpful.  

‚ó¶ **If the topic is *experimental* (comparison, challenge, versus, etc.)** ‚Üí  
   ‚Äì Summarise the experiment setup in 2‚Äë3 sentences.  
   ‚Äì List the contenders / variables.  
   ‚Äì Highlight the most surprising finding and why it matters.  

**Mini‚ÄëConclusion (2‚ÄØsentences)** ‚Äì wrap up value and tease that the full script will dive deeper.

## OUTPUT RULES
‚Ä¢ Plain text only‚Äîno Markdown fences, no JSON.  
‚Ä¢ At least **1000 words**.  
‚Ä¢ Each bullet line starts with ‚Äú‚Äì ‚Äù (en dash + space).  
‚Ä¢ One blank line between Intro, Main Summary, and Mini‚ÄëConclusion.

=You are a research assistant. Your task is to extract information from these websites scraped content for the given title {{ $('On form submission').item.json['Provide topic'] }}, analyze the information, and prepare a summarized content.
Rules:
- Ensure the summary is based solely on the given title.
- Generate a single, cohesive summary from the extracted information.

parameters.content:
# ü§ñ YouTube Content Generator (Shorts & Long Videos)
This workflow is a content multiplier that automatically creates scripts for two different video formats from a single topic. When you submit an idea, it generates both a concise script for a YouTube Short and a detailed script for a long-form video, saving both directly to Google Docs.

## üìù Core Functions
### The workflow splits into two specialized paths after you submit your topic:
### Branch 1 (For YouTube Shorts):
- This path is designed for speed and impact.
- It performs a quick web search on the topic.
- An AI Agent (Gemini) immediately processes the information to write a short, punchy, and engaging script perfect for the Shorts format.
### Branch 2 (For Long-Form Videos):
- This path is designed for depth and structure.
- It conducts a more detailed web search and summarizes the key findings.
- It then uses AI to generate a proper video outline (e.g., Intro, Main Points, Call to Action, Outro).
- A final AI Agent uses this detailed outline to write a comprehensive, well-structured script suitable for a full-length YouTube video.
## üõ†Ô∏è Setup Instructions
### To use this workflow, you'll need to configure the following credentials:
- On form submission Trigger: Configure this with your form or provide data manually. It should contain the video topic.
- Tavily Nodes: Add your Tavily API key for web search capabilities.
- Google Gemini Chat Model: Connect your Google AI credentials for the AI processing steps.
- Google Docs Nodes: Authenticate your Google account (using OAuth2) to allow n8n to create and update documents in your Google Drive.
## üöÄ How to Use
- Activate the workflow.
- Submit your video topic through the connected form.
- Wait for the workflow to execute both branches.
- Check your Google Drive and Docs. You will find two new documents: one script for your YouTube Short and another for your long-form video.

The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
